listitem.para: Tested with GlassFish v5.x and Apache Tomcat 5.5.20

section.title: Installation Instructions
section.para: The following applies to the &ws.impl.name; standalone bundles.

listitem.para:
To use with GlassFish
GlassFish contains &ws.impl.name; within Metro package so no installation required. For updating &ws.impl.name; installation in GlassFish please refer to Metro project.

To install on Tomcat
Set CATALINA_HOME to your Tomcat installation.
Run ant installThis essentially copies lib/*.jar from the root of &ws.impl.name; extracted bundle to $CATALINA_HOME/shared/lib
If you are running on top of JDK8, run ant install-apior use ant -help for detailed information.

section.para: If you intend to only invoke an already existing Web service, then alternatively you can use the wsimport and wsgen scripts in the bin directory of the &ws.impl.name.full; bundle.

section.title: Running on top of JDK 8
section.para: JDK includes &ws.spec.name; and JAXB API and RI. &ws.impl.name.full; includes RI of &ws.spec.name;/JAXB 2.3. In order to run &ws.impl.name.full; you would need to specify ONLY jakarta.xml.ws-api.jar, and jakarta.xml.bind-api.jar jars using the Java Endorsed Standards Override Mechanism

listitem.para: The java.util.Collection classes cannot be used with rpc/literal or document/literal BARE style due to a limitation in JAXB. However, they do work in the default document/literal WRAPPED style.

Although &ws.spec.name; customizations are portable across implementations, the names of WSDL and schema files generated are not specified. Therefore each vendor may and most likely will generate different names. Therefore, when switching between implementations of &ws.spec.name;, it may be necessary to modify your customization files to reflect different WSDL and schema file names.

This holds true for different releases of the &ws.impl.name;. The &ws.impl.name; may in each release change these file names to resolve bugs. If and when this does occur, a developer would need to change the filenames in their customization files to match the new file names.
